string.text: Quick Use Repair Kit
You are about to salvage a powerful item. Are you sure?
You cannot salvage. Your inventory is full.
Cannot salvage because {currency} is at maximum capacity.
You cannot equip this item in this slot
Please fill in rating or feedback
You have played {days} days {hours} hours {minutes} minutes and {seconds} seconds.
If you run out of wound resistance, you will become wounded and regain stamina at a much lower rate
If you run out of corruption resistance, you will become corrupted and take damage equal to {[Type_StatusEffectData.Curse.HealthModifierPercent * -100]}% base health instantly.
If you run out of frostbite resistance, you will become frostbitten and be unable to run or dodge for {[Afflictions.AfflictionFrostBite.AfflictedDrainTime]} seconds.
If you run out of acid resistance, you will suffer Acid burn and take 500% more damage from acid. You can remove Acid Burn with Acid Tinctures which can be crafted at an arcane station.
If you run out of breath, you suffocate and die

If you run out of blight resistance, you will become blighted and deal {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.DMGStandard * 100]}% reduced damage, take {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealMod * 100]}% reduced healing, and lose {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealthModifierPercent * -100]}% of your base health every {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.TickRate]} seconds for {[Afflictions.AfflictionBlight.AfflictedDrainTime]} seconds.
At the end of this timer, the player with the lowest health is afflicted with Combustible.
If you run out of resistance, a silence zone will be cast on you. The zone will detonate after a time, dealing damage to players. Resistance is shared among all members of your group.

If you run out of resistance, a Weary zone will be cast on you, slowing your movement and increasing all damage you take. Using abilities increases resistance. Resistance is shared among all members of your group.
While wounded, you regain stamina at a much lower rate
While corrupted, you lose {[Type_StatusEffectData.Curse.HealthModifierPercent * 100]}% base health instantly.
While frostbitten, you cannot run or dodge
While suffering acid burn, you take 500% more damage from acid. You can remove Acid Burn with Acid Tnctures which can be crafted at an arcane station.

While blighted, you deal {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.DMGStandard * 100]}% reduced damage, take {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealMod * 100]}% reduced healing, and lose {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.HealthModifierPercent * 100]}% of your base health every {[Type_StatusEffectData.Blight.TickRate]} seconds.
When this timer expires, the player with the lowest percent health becomes Combustible.
Using abilities will fill the bar. Blowback is cast on all players once full.
By continuing, you agree to the

All confidential information you receive or learn by participating in the Test or otherwise relating to the Game Materials, including their existence, technology, features, gameplay, look and feel, and any plans for release, must be kept strictly confidential under the nondisclosure agreement(s) you signed when you joined Amazon ("NDA") and the requirements below. Amazon is very serious about this - if you disclose, intentionally or unintentionally, anything about the Test or the Game Materials, you risk loss of your job and possible legal action.

Use [{keyName}] to place your camp. You can use the camp to rest or craft, and you can respawn there if you die. Placing and removing your camp is free, but you can only have one camp at a time.
Hold [{keyName}] to deconstruct your camp so you can place it in a new location. Placing and removing your camp is free, but you can only have one camp at a time.

Azoth is primarily acquired by completing Quests and closing Corruption Breaches.

Unlocked through discovering the quest "Secrets of the Heartgem" in Brimstone Sands</font>

Heartgem gains charge by performing various actions in combat:

  Taking damage (including blocked hits).

  Applying buffs (including heals) and debuffs.

Respawning at the inn would trigger the inn cooldown. Since this settlement is the closest one to you, you should respawn at the settlement and save the inn cooldown for when you're closer to a different settlement.

Respawning at your house would trigger your house cooldown. Since this settlement is the closest one to you, you should respawn at the settlement and save your house cooldown for when you're closer to a different settlement.
Repeated deaths while flagged for PvP will put camp respawn locations on a cooldown.\nRespawning at a non-camp location will reset this timer.
This will put this respawn position in cooldown. Continue?

A World Set is a collection of selected Worlds. Worlds within a World Set may be merged together if necessary to give players the best experience.
How many characters can I have per World Set?
You can have 1 character per World Set. You will need to delete your character if you want to play in another world within a World Set as characters cannot be transferred or move to other worlds.

Primary attribute for the War Hammer, Great Axe, Sword, Hatchet and Blunderbuss.

Secondary attribute for the Spear.

Greatsword scales evenly with this attribute and Dexterity.

Primary attribute for the Bow, Rapier, Spear and Musket.

Secondary attribute for the Sword, and Hatchet.

Greatsword scales evenly with this attribute and Strength.
Primary attribute for the Fire Staff, Ice Gauntlet, and Void Gauntlet.\n\nSecondary attribute for the Rapier, Musket and Blunderbuss.
Primary attribute for the Life Staff.\n\nSecondary attribute for the Void Gauntlet.

FAITH

Putting points into Faith increases:

-- Total Mana
-- Defense against Void Damage
-- Corruption Resistance

-- Spell Potency of Celestial Casting Gauntlets

PHYSIQUE

Putting points into Physique increases:

-- Defense against Physical Damage
-- Poison Resistance
-- Maximum Equip Load

ENDURANCE

Putting points into Endurance increases:

-- Stamina
-- Defense against Lightning Damage
-- Wound Resistance
Recover and reassign your Attribute Points.
The maximum amount of weight that the Character can carry in their backpack.
The maximum amount of weight that the Character can have equipped on their person.
The Character's resistance to Afflictions. It acts as a pool that is depleted by affliction damage.
The amount of Wound Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Poison Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Frostbite Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Corruption Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of Disease Affliction that must be accrued before the Character is Afflicted.
The amount of reduction applied to unblocked damage before Absorption is calculated.

string.-comment: We want to use a pipe character '|' between these and a percent '%' after absorption because that's how the numbers are ultimately displayed

string.text:
You have <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{defense} Defense</font> against this type of damage. Defense is determined by your attributes and how much armor you have, but not what type.

You have <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">{absorption}% Absorption</font> against this type of damage. Absorption is determined by your equipment's stats.

When you take damage, it is reduced first by your defense value, then by your absorption percent.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Standard</font> type damage is shared by many weapons and creatures.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Slash</font> type damage is generally more effective against flesh.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Magic</font> type damage is generally more effective against the corrupted.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Fire</font> type damage is generally more effective against flesh.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Thrust</font> type damage is generally more effective against heavy armor.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Strike</font> type damage is generally more effective against light armor.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Lightning</font> type damage is generally more effective against creatures.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Void</font> type damage is generally more effective against the uncorrupted.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Siege</font> type damage is generally more effective against structures.
The percentage reduction applied to incoming damage after it has been reduced by Defense.
You have placed all of these items.
You can't build on territory claimed by someone else.
You must claim this land before you can build on it.
Continue your story to join a faction

Cannot be claimed as a 3rd party until War ends.

Territory Influence is a measure of a Faction's control of a Territory. By completing <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" >PvP Faction Missions</font>, you contribute to your Faction's Territory Influence. Attacking Factions that reach 100% Territory Influence enables a declaration of war.

Turning on criminal intent will allow you to damage innocent players and their structures.

Unlock Camp (Tier 1)
Placing a Tier 1 camp allows you to craft various Tier 1 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.
To unlock, you must be Level 5 and have completed the starting survivalist quest.
Note: You must complete the preceding starting settlement and beach quests before undertaking this quest.

While in a lawless area, you will not be marked as a criminal for any crimes you commit.\n\nYou must still enable criminal intent to damage any non-criminals, but you will not receive the usual penalties.

Rock, Paper, Scissors, a light-hearted game with friends or a tool for making difficult decisions.
Enable your Steam Overlay in Steam's Settings
Items have been added to or removed from your account.
If you, or anyone in your family, have an epileptic condition, consult your physician prior to playing New World.

A very small percentage of individuals may experience epileptic seizures when exposed to certain visual images, including light patterns or flashing lights that may appear in video game or other video content. Exposure to certain patterns or backgrounds on a computer screen, or while playing video games, may induce an epileptic seizure in these individuals. Certain conditions may induce previously undetected epileptic symptoms even in persons who have no history of prior seizures or epilepsy.

If you experience any of the following symptoms while playing - dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitches, loss of awareness, disorientation, any involuntary movement, or convulsions - discontinue use IMMEDIATELY and consult your physician before resuming use of New World.
New World is a work of supernatural fiction about cultures from around the world banding together to fight for the fate of humanity.
The New World team consulted with experts and our diverse workforce on the depictions of the cultures we've drawn from, and will continue to do so as we add more in the future.
If you, or anyone in your family, have a history of seizures or epilepsy, consult your doctor prior to playing.

Camp (Tier 1)

Placing a Tier 1 camp allows you to craft various Tier 1 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 2, you must be Level 15 and have completed the “Survivalist: Friends in Fashion” quest.

Camp (Tier 2)

Placing a Tier 2 camp allows you to craft various Tier 2 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 3, you must be Level 25 and have completed the “Animal Instincts” quest.

Camp (Tier 3)

Placing a Tier 3 camp allows you to craft various Tier 3 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 4, you must be Level 40 and have completed the “Survivalist: Lupine Obersvations” quest.

Camp (Tier 4)

Placing a Tier 4 camp allows you to craft various Tier 4 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.

To upgrade your camp to Tier 5, you must be Level 55 and have completed the “Survivalist: Fading Lights” quest.
Camp (Tier 5)\n\nPlacing a Tier 5 camp allows you to craft various Tier 5 items, heal your character, and respawn at the camp.
Skin will be applied on your next camp

Expertise is used to measure the maximum power of an item when you have it equipped.

<font color="#ffffff" face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">How to increase Expertise</font>

<font color="#ffd45f" face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_Bold.font">Elite POIs and Expeditions</font>
Drops from creatures or chests in level 60+ areas have a chance to increase this value.

<font color="#ffd45f" face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font">Crafting</font>
Crafting a 600 GS item will increase Expertise of this item type.

<font color="#ffd45f" face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font">Gypsum Cast</font>
Opening a Gypsum Cast will increase Expertise.

<font color="#ffd45f" face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font">Item Upgrade (with Umbral Shards)</font>
After you reach 600 Expertise, the only way to increase Expertise is via upgrading items with Umbral Shards.

After enough fish are caught at a hotspot, it will become depleted. You can tell a hotspot is depleted when there are no fish jumping. A depleted hotspot will become active again after some time has passed.

You can tell a fishing hotspot is active when you see fish jumping out of it. While it’s active, landing your cast within the hotspot will yield quicker bites and rarer fish. When you place your line correctly, you’ll see a small alert telling you you’ve hit the hotspot.
Expertise System - Raising Your Gear Score
Locations to Increase Expertise per Level
So you’ve hit Level 60! Congratulations! The world of Aeternum is now completely open to you. Here are the highlights of what life is like in the endgame.

At Level 60 you have access to several new expeditions: Garden of Genesis in Edengrove, The Lazarus Instrumentality in Reekwater, Tempest’s Heart in Shattered Mountain, and Barnacles and Black Powder in Cutlass Keys.\n\nKeep an eye out for the circular red icon around two Expeditions at a time on the map—this means that Expedition is currently Mutated and offers higher difficulties but greater rewards. Some of the best endgame rewards come from the end bosses in Mutated Expeditions (more on that later).

At Level 60, you gain access to Outpost Rush. You can queue for the mode from any Faction representative, or some NPCs in Northern outposts, or the Modes tab on the nav bar. You can enter a queue solo or with a group of up to five.

The mode is a 20v20 PvPvE instanced battleground. There are three outposts which can be claimed to generate points for your team. They can be upgraded via gathering resources in the area and adding them to the gates, cannons, and more. To win, you’ll need to claim and hold these outposts, and the first team to 1,000 points wins the match.

As long as you make a minimum contribution of 500 points for your team, either through PvP or PvE, you will get rewards at the end of the match.

When a territory is under attack from the Corrupted, you can sign up at the local War Board or the Upcoming Wars tab on the Map Screen to help defend the territory. Any faction can sign up, and there are 40 open slots chosen by the system each time. Invasions come in 6 waves, and the fort must be defended from being claimed by the Corrupted. If they do, the local settlement will experience random downgrades to its crafting stations or local lifestyle buffs.

There is a number next to each equippable gear slot in your inventory. This number is the expertise for each type of gear. This number is the highest Gear Score (GS) you can equip in each slot effectively. As you get loot from Level 61+ enemies, you will have a chance of receiving gear of slightly higher Gear Score than your current expertise, which will bump your expertise to be equal to the Gear Score of the gear you got. Event chests as in Outpost Rush can also give you an expertise ‘bump.’

• Level 61 Enemies drop: 500-530 Gear Score items
• Level 62 Enemies drop: 530-560 Gear Score items
• Level 63 Enemies drop: 560-591 Gear Score items
• Level 64 Enemies drop: 590-600 Gear Score items

You are able to equip gear at higher Gear Scores than your current expertise that you acquire through Trading, but it will not be effective beyond your current expertise score, and it will not increase your expertise score.

Enemies found in elite landmarks and expeditions have a higher base chance of increasing your Expertise score, as do level 60+ named enemies. Expedition Bosses will ALWAYS drop an item that increases your Expertise, and Expeditions themselves will ALWAYS provide 3 items (1 from the aforementioned Bosses) throughout each run. The chance of receiving an expertise drop from an Elite Chest is higher than from defeating an Elite enemy.

500-525 Gear Score (Elite 61+) - Great Cleave: Mangled Heights, Shattered Mountain: Upper Svikin

525-549 Gear Score (Elite 62+) - Ebonscale Reach: Imperial Palace, Edengrove: Malevolence

549-577 Gear Score (Elite 63+) - Reekwater: Forecastle Drift, Shattered Mountain: Scorched Mines

577-591 Gear Score (Elite 64+) - Shattered Mountain: Myrkgard, Reekwater: Eternal Pool, Reekwater: Siren’s Stand

591+ Gear Score - Edengrove: Malevolence, Ebonscale Reach: Imperial Palace, Ebonscale Reach: North Dynasty Shipyard, Edengrove: Garden of Genesis, Reekwater: Lazarus Instrumentality, Edengrove: Monoecious Cleft Spriggan Arena, Reekwater: The Amphitheatre Arena, Edengrove: Eternal Pools Arena

Gypsum is the way to increase your expertise in a specific gear type.

Gypsum comes in different varieties, each of which can be used at a Gypsum Kiln to craft a Gypsum Orb. You’ll need a certain quantity of each type in order to craft 1 Gypsum Orb. A Gypsum Orb can then be used to create a Gypsum Cast of a specific gear type, which once consumed will grant a guaranteed Expertise bump for the chosen gear type and grant a new piece of gear of the higher gear score.

You can obtain Gypsum in various quantities by engaging in different activities as follows:

•Obsidian Gypsum, 3 per day – Level 60+ open-world named bosses, typically found in Elite Landmarks.
•Sapphire Gypsum, 2 per day – Lazarus Instrumentality and Garden of Genesis final bosses.
•Ruby Gypsum, 2 per day – Outpost Rush (must get at least 501 points in the match).
•Emerald Gypsum, 1 per day – Trade Skill Aptitude Reward Checkpoints.
•Citrine Gypsum, 2 per day – PvE arenas.
•Amethyst Gypsum, 7 per day – Closing Corrupted Breaches.
•Topaz Gypsum, 5 per day – Go to an Arcana Station or Tier 5 camp to craft an Attunement Potion. Drink the potion, then kill level 55+ enemies who will drop Topaz Gypsum.
•Diamond Gypsum, 3 per day – You can obtain Diamond Gypsum by gathering any type of node in Aeternum. This usually changes during Seasonal Events such as the Winter Convergence.
•Garnet Gypsum, 2 per day – 3v3 PVP Arenas.

Umbral Shards can be used to upgrade any piece of gear which has a minimum Gear Score of 590, up to a maximum of 625. If the gear is equipped when upgraded, it will increase your Expertise score as well.\n\nUmbral Shards can be obtained from OPR, opening High Level Elite Chests, Mutated Expeditions, Crafting High-Level Gear, and from opening Gypsum Casts for gear slots whose Expertise is level 600 or higher.
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#ffdb7a">Endgame Expeditions</font>, including rotating weekly Mutations for the best rewards
<font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#ffdb7a">Elite</font> landmarks, Trial Arenas, and open world challenges for groups
Visit a <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#ffdb7a">Gypsum Kiln</font> to upgrade your gear

During the Free Weekend event, any player may download New World and create a character to play. Some worlds are restricted to players who have purchased New World. Free players may not transfer characters between worlds nor access the Store and Trading Post. Free player characters are also restricted to a maximum of 2,000 .

Use the Social Menu (default: [O]) to search for friends in the same world or respond to invites from other players. Participate and join multiplayer activities such as Arena and Outpost Rush from the Modes tab in the Escape Menu [ESC]. Find a party and embark on an Expedition by opening the Group Finder menu from the map by hovering over any Expedition’s icon.

For free players, New World periodically checks to see if there is a queue for their character’s world. Players may play as long as they like if their world has no queue when this session time check is made. If there is a queue at that time, the free player will be returned to the Main Menu and may queue to reenter the world. If there is no queue at that time, the free player’s session time will be extended until the next check. Players who have purchased New World do not have session time checks and have queue priority over free players.

New World can be purchased through the Steam Store, which can be accessed from the Main Menu or the Menu button via the Escape Menu [ESC]. All characters, items, and progress earned as a free player will be carried forward after purchasing New World. However, only the total time played by all characters on an account after purchase will accrue towards unlocking features such as Player-to-Player Trading and access to the Store and Trading Post.

Before joining a faction, you must prove yourself by completing a series of Faction Initiation Quests. Reach Level 17 and seek out the initial quest givers for each faction in or near the village of Oxboro in Everfall.

By joining a faction, you get access to Faction Missions, open world PvP, and Wars. You will be able to take part in shifting control of territories towards your faction.\n\nAdventuring within a territory your faction controls will grant several varying bonuses, such as increased XP gain.
Players in a faction can form companies and invite other players who are either in the same faction or not in any faction. The players without a faction still cannot take part in PvP or join Wars.

Companies have the potential to make their leader the Governor of a territory by winning a War against its current owners. See Declaring War in the Player versus Player (PvP) and War guide for more info on how to start and fight Wars.

Once you are in a faction, you can choose to enable your PvP Flag. Enabling your PvP Flag allows you to participate in open world player vs. player combat. While your flag is enabled, you can attack and be attacked by other flagged players from the other factions.\n\nTo toggle your PvP Flag on or off, press the Toggle PvP button (default: U) while in a Settlement or any other sanctuary.

Flagged players can battle at each Fort for its control.

To take part, flag for PvP then go to the Fort you wish to compete for and enter through any of the gates. Once inside, claim and hold your ground against players from the other factions.

The faction that holds the Fort gains bonuses in the territory like increased influence and XP gains for faction members. Owning a Fort does not affect overall control of the territory, but may be instrumental in declaring a war for ownership.

Taking part in open world PvP and doing PvP missions for your faction in a territory will help to build influence. If your faction owns the territory, your influence helps to delay the ability of your enemies to declare a War. If you are not part of the ruling faction, your influence helps to build towards a War declaration.\n\nOnce an attacking faction gains enough influence, the territory is thrown into conflict and company owners may declare a War. Declaring War schedules a 50 vs. 50 Siege battle at the Fort.

Players may sign up to participate in a scheduled Siege battle at the War Board in the territory's Settlement or outside its Fort.

The Governors of the two leading companies may choose from the players that have signed up for their side to build their 50 player armies.

If chosen to participate, an invite banner will appear shortly before the Siege battle is scheduled to begin. If you accept, you will be teleported to you army's spawn area for the battle to prepare. If you decline, your spot will open for a player assigned to the army's backfill list.

Players from the attacking or defending faction may only sign up for their faction's side of the War. Players from the third faction may sign up for either side. Players without a faction may not join Wars.

During a Siege battle, the two teams first battle for control of three points outside the Fort.

Defenders start in control of all three points. Attackers claim points by keeping players within the claim ring.

Once all three claim points are taken, the Attackers must destroy the Fort's gates to access a final claim point in the central yard.

The Attackers win the War if they can claim the final point before the battle's time limit expires.
Any qualifying player can join the instanced player vs. player game modes regardless of faction alignment. These modes are found in the Modes screen from the main navigation menu.

Outpost Rush is a 20 vs. 20 match that takes place on a large island with three Outposts.

Teams score points by capturing and holding outposts.

The first team to 1,000 points wins the match.

The island features special resources and creatures that can be harnessed by the teams to swing the battle in their favor.

In 3v3 Arenas, two teams battle to eliminate each other. The match takes place in a best of five format.

Eliminate the entire opposing team to win a round.

Win three rounds to win the match.

Consumables are not allowed. The longer a round continues, the weaker healing abilities become. And If the round lasts too long, a ring of fire will begin to close until one side has won.

Event ends in: {timeLeft}
